reports.title: name="The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt" appid="292030" target_framerate="40-49 FPS title="Optimized settings for stable 40 FPS on Steam Deck OLED."

data.summary: Optimized settings for stable 40 FPS on Steam Deck OLED.
data.game_display_settings:
- **Display Mode:** Fullscreen
- **Vsync:** Off
- **Resolution:** 1280x800
- **Maximum Frames Per Second:** Unlimited
data.game_graphics_settings:
- **Anti-Aliasing:** TAAU
- **Sharpening:** Low
- **Screen Space Ambient Occlusion:** SSAO
- **Screen Space Reflections:** High
- **Motion Blur:** Off
- **Blur:** On
- **Bloom:** On
- **Depth of Field:** On
- **Chromatic Aberration:** Off
- **Vignetting:** Off
- **Light Shafts:** On
- **Camera Lens Effects:** Off
- **NVIDIA HairWorks:** Off
- **Number of Background Characters:** Medium
- **Shadow Quality:** Medium
- **Terrain Quality:** Medium
- **Water Quality:** Medium
- **Foliage Visibility Range:** Medium
- **Grass Density:** Low
- **Texture Quality:** High
- **Detail Level:** Medium
data.additional_notes:
[![Video Guide](https://img.shields.io/badge/Video%20Guide-FF0000?logo=youtube)](https://youtu.be/SyWSSJYsg9s?t=670)

This setup targets a consistent 40 FPS, stable even in demanding areas like Novigrad, but drops may occur in other areas if aiming higher. DirectX 11 is recommended as DX12 caused frame rate issues.

The QAM frame limiter is disabled, and tearing is allowed to minimise input lag.

Optionally, follow instructions on [PC Gaming Wiki](https://www.pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/The_Witcher_3:_Wild_Hunt) for these:
- Set Proper HUD positioning for 16:10
- Skip REDlauncher on start-up (after selecting DX11 for the first launch)
